message:
The bill has had immediate repercussions. The website craigslist.com announced on Friday that it was shutting down its popular "personal" sections on its website, where sex advertisements are often placed.
Craigslist said in a statement. "Any tool or service can be misused… We can't take such risk without jeopardizing all our other services, so we are regretfully taking Craigslist personals offline. Hopefully, we can bring them back someday."

data.description: “My hope is that it will create a deterrent for those who think it's OK to sell kids online."
data.title: Congress' Just-Passed Child Sex Trafficking Bill Has Already Had An Impact
